intro: Pogonanthera intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate pogonanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes evening primroses and willows. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Pogonanthera intermedia is often found in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist, sandy soils.
